column1: 2	How does Apple manage supply chain risks?	"Apple manages supply chain risks in several ways:
1. **Diversification of Suppliers**: Apple works to qualify multiple suppliers for key components where feasible to minimize production risks due to disruptions in the supply chain.
2. **Safety Stock and Die Banks**: The company maintains safety stock for key parts and assemblies
column2: as well as die banks for components with lengthy procurement lead times to mitigate potential disruptions.

column1: 3. **Long-Term Supply Contracts**: Apple strives to execute long-term supply contracts for raw materials at competitive pricing when possible to secure access to necessary resources.
4. **Close Relationships with Vendors**: Apple has developed close relationships with key vendors of parts like battery cells
column3: and complex vehicle assemblies
column4: allowing them to take advantage of pricing efficiencies from economies of scale.

column1: By taking these measures
column2: Apple aims to minimize the impact of supply chain disruptions and ensure the availability of components necessary for their products."	"['The Company uses some custom components that are not commonly used by its competitors

column6: may be affected if suppliers decide to concentrate on the production of common components instead of components customized to meet the Company’s requirements.\nSubstantially all of the Company’s hardware products are manufactured by outsourcing partners that are located primarily in China mainland
column7: India

column1: 4	How does Tesla approach innovation in electric vehicles?	"Tesla approaches innovation in electric vehicles through a multi-faceted strategy. They focus on developing their core vehicle technology competencies including powertrain engineering and manufacturing to design vehicles that maximize the advantages of an electric powertrain. Tesla designs adaptable
column3: reliable
column4: and cost-effective powertrain systems that can withstand the rigors of an automotive environment. They offer dual motor powertrain vehicles for all-wheel drive configurations and vehicles with three electric motors for increased performance.

column1: In terms of batteries
column2: Tesla conducts extensive testing and research to develop new proprietary lithium-ion battery cells and improve manufacturing processes to achieve higher energy density at lower costs. They leverage their knowledge of lithium-ion cell chemistry to enhance battery performance in their vehicles.

column1: Moreover
column2: Tesla is at the forefront of integrating vehicle control and infotainment software to enhance the driving experience. They are also pioneers in autonomous driving technology
column3: aiming to establish a Tesla ride-hailing network in the future.

column3: and sales strategies for future growth."	"['Our focus on cloud-based services presents execution and competitive risks. A growing part of our business involves cloud-based services available across the spectrum of computing devices. Our strategic vision is to compete and grow by building best-in-class platforms and productivity services that utilize ubiquitous computing and ambient intelligence to drive insights and productivity gains. At the same time
column4: our competitors are rapidly developing and deploying cloud-based services for consumers and business customers. Pricing and delivery models are evolving. Devices and form factors influence how users access services in the cloud and sometimes the user’s choice of which cloud-based services to use. Certain industries and customers have specific requirements for cloud services and may present enhanced risks. We are devoting significant resources to develop and deploy our cloud-based strategies. The Windows ecosystem must continue to evolve with this changing environment. We embrace cultural and organizational changes to drive accountability and eliminate obstacles to innovation. Our intelligent cloud and intelligent edge offerings are connected to the growth of the Internet of Things (“IoT”)
column5: a network of distributed and interconnected devices employing sensors
column7: and computing capabilities
column8: including AI. Our success in driving ubiquitous computing and ambient intelligence will depend on the level of adoption of our offerings such as Azure
